definition: stammeringly
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: And you don't want to stutter and stammer.
sentences.chinese: 而你又不想结结巴巴地说。

sentences.english: She stumbled over the long word .
sentences.chinese: 她结结巴巴地说那个长词。

sentences.english: Whenever I talk in front of an audience, I got tongue-tied.
sentences.chinese: 一面对不雅众讲话，我就结结巴巴的。

sentences.english: He jerked out his story to his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴地向老板讲了事情经过。

sentences.english: He stammered his cheek hot one much time.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴地说着，不尽又红了脸。

sentences.english: He began to sputter his reply.
sentences.chinese: 他开始结结巴巴地回答。

sentences.english: He splattered that he didn't see her.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴地说，他没有见到她。

sentences.english: She faltered out a few words.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴说出几个字来。

sentences.english: She scarily stuttered out his name.
sentences.chinese: 她害怕地结结巴巴说出了他的名字。
他结结巴巴的讲了个借口。

sentences.english: His regrets was stuttering to me.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴地向我道了歉。

sentences.english: He is not likely to falter on such an occasion.
sentences.chinese: 在这种场合下他是不大可能结结巴巴的。

sentences.english: Her tongue stammered and faulted with rage.
sentences.chinese: 她讲话因生气而结结巴巴并出错。

sentences.english: He speaks haltingly, but with feeling, in Na’vi.
sentences.chinese: 他结结巴巴，但充满感情地用纳美语说着。
“我不会跳舞，”你结结巴巴地说。

sentences.english: Flustered, the ventriloquist begins to stammer out an apology.
sentences.chinese: 口技表演者感到了不安，他结结巴巴地准备道歉。

definition: stammering/stuttering/not speaking fluently
stammering (idiom)
to stutter
to stammer/to mumble/to speak haltingly
(of speech) indistinct/mumbling/hesitating
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
talkative/light and soft (of voice)
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to resist/to deal with
sullen/to scowl miserably
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
embarrassed
shy
incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
